alert.note: Alert for Northern Elko County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 29 at 1:49AM PST by NWS Elko
info.description: ...Snow and blowing snow to continue across portions of northern Elko county through 4 am this morning... An area of snow showers will be moving across portions of northern Elko county through the early morning hours. Radar is showing an area of light snow from Owyhee south to Tuscarora, east to Jackpot and HD Summit on US Highway 93. State Route 225 will also be impacted with snow covered and slippery roads. North to northwest winds 10 to 15 mph with gusts to 25 mph will promote blowing and drifting snow, which will hamper visibility and exacerbate the hazardous driving conditions. Snow accumulations of an additional inch or so will continue until 4am this morning. Drivers are encouraged to use caution when driving this morning due to the snow and slick conditions. Visit www.weather.gov/elko for the latest weather information.
